content: Despite their nutritional and environmental benefits, people are increasingly moving away from insect-based foods. Urbanisation has created both physical and cultural distance from such practices. Many younger generations that have grown up or settled in cities are often unaware that insects are eaten across several parts of India

content: The interactions have drawn attention as the issue of leadership and power-sharing continues to be discussed publicly

content: Investigators revealed that one of the two ganja traders had built assets worth over ‚Çπ5 crore, allegedly shown as earnings from a roadside dhaba opened just two years ago

title: Tesla to offer a fortnight-long pop-up in Bengaluru, starting January 15
content: The pop-up will feature four Tesla Model Y and customers will be able to learn about Tesla‚Äôs design philosophy, cutting-edge electric vehicle technology, safety features, and performance capabilities in an interactive environment

content: Political and Muslim religious leaders describe move to seek details of mosques, its ideology and caretakers  as ‚Äòintrusive‚Äô and ‚Äòthreatening‚Äô

content: On January 7, the State Cabinet said there was no justification for extending Governor‚Äôs Rule in the Chakma Autonomous District Council

title: Aditya Sahu set to become Jharkhand BJP president

content: Assembly Speaker questions impartiality of the probe, says police seeking 10 days to reply despite ‚Äòinstant‚Äô FIR, investigation raises ‚Äòserious questions‚Äô; govt. flags Atishi‚Äôs silence, seeks answers from her; AAP demands apology from Tourism Minister

title: Prime Minister Modi to address public meeting in city on Jan. 23
content: The public meeting will be organised in a grand manner, in which AIADMK leaders, including the party general secretary and the NDA‚Äôs Chief Ministerial face Edappadi K. Palaniswami, and leaders from other alliance parties will share the stage with Mr. Modi

title: The UDF‚Äôs ray of hope in an uphill battle in Kerala
content: Kerala local body poll results give the Congress-led United Democratic Front momentum, but Assembly polls could be challenging

title: Mumbai set for high-stakes battle as campaigning for 29 civic body elections ends
content: Roadshows, door-to-door meetings dominate the day ahead of polls tomorrow; all eyes on country‚Äôs richest civic body, BMC; SEC declares polls to 12 zila parishads, 125 panchayat samitis to be held on Feb. 5

title: Tamil Nadu close to eliminating malaria as 33 districts report nil indigenous cases
content: Chennai is among the five districts that are yet to achieve zero transmission, accounting for nearly 37%-45% of the State‚Äôs malaria cases, even as the number has fallen from 173 in 2023 to 121 in 2025

title: Equality in society has to start in school, says Supreme Court
content: A Bench headed by Justice P.S. Narasimha elaborated that the obligation of the government under the Right to Education Act (RTE) to ensure that neighbourhood schools admit children belonging to weaker and disadvantaged sections has an ‚Äúextraordinary capacity to transform the social structure of our society‚Äù

title: 'Leave Iran': India's stark advisory amid threat of US attack; protests spread
content: India has issued an advisory urging its citizens in Iran to depart immediately due to escalating regional tensions and internal protests. The advisory, released by the Indian embassy in Tehran, advises students, pilgrims, business persons, and tourists to leave by available transport, including commercial flights, amid concerns of potential US military action and reported fatalities from unrest.

title: 'Mamata seized records': ED trains guns on Bengal CM; I-PAC raid row in HC
content: The Calcutta High Court has restricted courtroom entry for hearings concerning the ED's raid on I-PAC director Pratik Jain's premises. Both the Trinamool Congress and the Enforcement Directorate filed petitions following the January 8 incident. The court will live-stream proceedings to manage access, as Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had alleged data seizure attempts ahead of polls.

title: LinkedIn founder to Americans: Tariffs are terrible; urges tech CEOs to speak up
content: LinkedIn founder Reid Hoffman has strongly criticized Trump administration policies, labeling tariffs, ICE operations, and anti-vaccination sentiments as "terrible." He urged Silicon Valley leaders to overcome fear and speak out against what they believe is wrong, emphasizing the importance of free speech.

title: Goa raises Class 1 age to six: India slows school entry, but the real alarm rings in pre-schools
content: Goa has introduced the Goa School Education Bill, 2026 to make six the minimum age for Class 1 entry, aligning its law with NEP 2020 and the RTE framework. The move reflects a wider national push to slow down early formal schooling. But the real pressure point is pre-school: Studies suggest that quality and readiness remain uneven.

title: Run machine keeps ticking: Kohli breaks Tendulkar's record; achieves this milestone
content: Virat Kohli surpassed Sachin Tendulkar to become India's highest ODI run-scorer against New Zealand, reaching 1,773 runs. He achieved this milestone during the second ODI on Wednesday. Kohli's innings ended at 23, but he now sits second overall behind Ricky Ponting in this specific batting record.

title: $200,000 for palak paneer? Old US campus settlement explodes on social media
content: In a notable case echoing beyond academia, the University of Colorado Boulder has reached a $200,000 settlement with two Indian PhD candidates following a controversial incident involving palak paneer. The students claimed they faced discrimination due to food odors and an unwelcoming atmosphere stemming from a 2023 altercation with staff.

title: Amazon's RTO gets stricter: Managers tracking hours; three types of employees under scanner
content: Amazon is now closely monitoring office attendance, tracking not just presence but also exact hours spent by corporate employees. This escalation in surveillance, revealed by an internal document, flags 'Low-Time Badgers' and 'Zero Badgers' who don't meet in-office expectations. The move follows a strict five-day return-to-office mandate, with similar tracking systems emerging at tech rivals like Samsung and Dell.

title: 500 stray dogs killed in Telangana villages in one week
content: Stray dogs were allegedly culled using lethal injections in Telangana's Kamareddy and Hanamkonda districts, with elected representatives reportedly fulfilling election promises. Police have registered cases against several sarpanches and others involved. Carcasses were exhumed for post-mortem examinations, and viscera samples sent for analysis. The Supreme Court also expressed concern over stray animal management.

title: Budget 2026: Increased expenditure, clear roadmap & more ‚Äî here's what highways need
content: India's highway network has surged, becoming the world's second-largest with over 61% expansion in a decade. Future plans emphasize access-controlled highways, technology, and sustainability.  Significant public-private partnerships and a new infrastructure trust are set to fund ambitious development, despite ongoing challenges with approvals and execution.

title: ‚ÄòWhen admitted to the hospital‚Äô: Iyer recalls ‚Äòexcruciatingly painful‚Äô injury
content: Shreyas Iyer revealed he only realised the seriousness of his spleen injury from the Australia ODI after being hospitalised, calling the pain ‚Äúexcruciatingly painful‚Äù. The setback forced him to slow down and reflect. Following medical advice, he recovered well and returned strongly, scoring 49 against New Zealand while trusting his instincts and focusing on team balance.

title: Musk Vs OpenAI legal battle: Judge sets April 27 trial date; jury to hear fraud claims
content: A high-stakes legal battle between Elon Musk and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is heading to trial this spring. Musk accuses Altman of fraud over OpenAI's shift to a for-profit model and partnership with Microsoft, alleging a betrayal of the company's altruistic founding mission. Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers found sufficient evidence for a jury trial, set to begin April 28.

title: India‚ÄìGreece ties: First-ever joint services staff talks held in Delhi
content: India and Greece have initiated their first Joint Services Staff Talks in New Delhi, aiming to bolster defence partnerships and military-to-military cooperation. The dialogue focused on expanding bilateral engagement through exchange programs, capability development, and enhancing operational ties, signaling a new era of trust and shared security commitments.

title: 'Girls in North India asked to stay home, give birth': DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran sparks row
content: Tamil Nadu's commitment to girls' education was highlighted by DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran, who contrasted the state's progressive approach with perceived limitations in northern regions. Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin distributed laptops to 900 students, emphasizing education over social media and reiterating the government's dedication to empowering women through learning and career opportunities.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection: Film crosses Rs 810 crore; does better than 'The Raja Saab'
content: Remarkably, 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office reign, outperforming new releases and even the Hindi version of 'The Raja Saab' in its sixth week.  The Ranveer Singh starrer has now surpassed 'Stree 2' as the highest-earning film in Week 6, showcasing incredible staying power and audience appeal.

title: ICC ODI rankings: Back where he belongs ‚Äî Virat Kohli returns to No.1
content: Virat Kohli has reclaimed the No.1 spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings after a stellar 93 against New Zealand. This marks his 11th stint at the top, underscoring his enduring dominance and a remarkable sequence of recent performances. The Indian great continues his pursuit of Sachin Tendulkar's records, solidifying his legacy as a premier run-scorer.

title: 'She was having an affair...': Mary Kom's ex-husband reacts after cheating allegations
content: India's boxing champion Mary Kom has accused her ex-husband Karung Onkholer of financial fraud, claiming he stole ‚Çπ10 lakh and transferred her assets. In response, Onkholer alleges Mary had extramarital affairs in 2013 and 2017, presenting WhatsApp messages as proof. He denies financial wrongdoing and states he managed their children while she was the primary earner.

title: 'Don‚Äôt know how he‚Äôs alive': US health secretary on Trump‚Äôs 'unhinged eating habits'
content: Despite a diet heavy in McDonald's, candy, and Diet Coke, President Donald Trump, nearing 80, is reportedly in excellent health. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. described Trump's eating habits as "unhinged" but acknowledged his remarkable energy and a recent medical assessment indicating high testosterone levels and a healthy cardiovascular system.

title: Aravali degradation: Encroachments, mining & urban sprawl hit ecology - study
content: A new study reveals that encroachments, deforestation, and urban expansion have severely damaged the Aravalli ranges, impacting groundwater, biodiversity, and air quality. The report highlights the weakening of the Aravalli's role as a green barrier, accelerating desertification and threatening ecological stability in northern India. A community-inclusive eco-restoration model is proposed to address these critical issues.

title: Iran protests turn deadly as over 2500 killed; internet restored partially
content: Iran faces widespread unrest with over 2,500 reported deaths amid protests against economic hardship. Authorities signal swift trials for detainees, drawing a strong warning from US President Trump. France calls the crackdown the most violent in contemporary history. While some phone lines reopened, internet access remains restricted, leaving many isolated.

title: Study in Australia dream on thin ice? What it means to move to highest visa-risk category
content: Australia‚Äôs move to place India in its highest student visa risk category has significant implications for Indian students planning to study abroad. From January 2026, applications will face stricter scrutiny, longer processing times, and deeper verification. Experts say genuine students can still succeed, but success now hinges on careful preparation, credible intent, aligned course choices, and financial transparency.

title: ‚ÄòI'm alone in the dark‚Äô: Trump‚Äôs dramatic fundraising email triggers online criticism
content: Donald Trump is seeking donations through a fundraising email. The message warns supporters of dire consequences if he faces impeachment again. It highlights potential changes to American lives if he does not meet fundraising deadlines. The email, shared online, has drawn criticism for its tone and appeal for money.

title: Sambhal case: Court orders FIR against 12 cops; SP refuses, calls directive ‚Äòillegal‚Äô
content: A Sambhal court ordered an FIR against 12 police officers, including a former CO and SHO, for an alleged shooting during the November 2024 Shahi Jama Masjid survey violence. Police, however, refused to comply, calling the order "illegal" and vowing to challenge it in a higher court, citing a prior judicial inquiry that validated police action.

title: Trump tariffs hit Xi wall: China posts record trade surplus in 2025
content: US-bound shipments did fall sharply after Donald Trump raised duties in 2025. But under Xi Jinping's guidance, Chinese exporters responded with speed and ingenuity. Sales surged instead to Southeast Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. In many cases, goods were routed through third countries, blunting the effect of US tariffs altogether.

title: Islamic Nato in making? How Turkish arms, Saudi cash and Pak nukes could align
content: Turkey is reportedly in advanced talks to join a defence pact between Pakistan and Saudi Arabia, mirroring Nato mutual defence clause. This potential alliance aims to bolster regional security amid shifting global dynamics and perceived US unreliability. The pact leverages Saudi financial strength, Pakistan's nuclear arsenal, and Turkey's military expertise and growing defence industry.

title: Chura-dahi feast: Tej Pratap Yadav courts NDA and family; Bihar awaits his next move
content: In a surprising twist, Tej Pratap Yadav, the son of RJD chief Lalu Prasad, has stirred the pot in Bihar politics with his unconventional 'chura-dahi' feast. After a notable meeting with NDA figures like CM Nitish Kumar, he took a decisive step by inviting family members, including brother Tejashwi, to celebrate Sankranti.

title: Pakistan ties up with crypto business of Donald Trump‚Äôs family
content: Pakistan has reportedly entered into an agreement with a company linked to World Liberty Financial, which is a crypto venture associated with the family of US President Donald Trump, to explore the use of its stablecoin for cross-border payments.

title: 30 killed in Thailand: Passenger train derails after crane collapses; several trapped
content: At least 30 people were killed and many were injured on Wednesday after a crane at an under-construction high-speed rail line in Thailand collapsed onto a passenger train, causing its derailment.  The accident happened in Sikhio district, Nakhon Ratchasima province, about 230 km northeast of Bangkok. Rescue operations are ongoing.

title: Rs 1.4 lakh cr wiped off from RIL ‚Äî What's ahead for Reliance Industries share?
content: Reliance Industries experienced a weak start to 2026, losing significant market capitalization due to concerns over Russian crude exposure and slowing retail growth. Despite near-term pressures, brokerages remain positive, anticipating strong performance in the energy business and multiple catalysts for stock outperformance throughout the year.

title: IND vs NZ: 'What rubbish is this?' - Ex-WC winner explodes over Badoni call-up
content: Former chief selector Krishnamachari Srikkanth has fiercely criticised Ayush Badoni's ODI call-up, questioning the selection basis and hinting at favouritism. Srikkanth argued against Badoni's all-rounder status and highlighted inconsistent selection criteria. The team management, however, defended the move, citing Badoni as a like-for-like replacement for the injured Washington Sundar to ensure team balance.

title: 'Who is he?': Trump's dig at Greenland PM as he 'chooses' Denmark over US
content: Trump has openly been pushing for the United States to acquire Greenland, dismissing Denmark‚Äôs role and warning that the Arctic island could otherwise fall under Russian or Chinese influence. Asked whether he had made a tangible offer to Greenland or Denmark, Trump replied, ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt done that. But Greenland should make the deal because Greenland does not want to see Russia or China take over.‚Äù

title: December WPI figures: Wholesale price inflation edges up to 0.83%
content: Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation returned to positive territory in December, rising to 0.83% after two months of deflation. This uptick was primarily driven by increased prices in manufacturing, minerals, and food products, while fuel and power remained in deflation. Retail inflation also climbed, prompting the RBI to maintain its accommodative stance.

title: Brain fog, joint pain, night sweats during menopause: Doctor explains what really happens
content: Menopause, often misunderstood, is a significant physical and mental shift for women. Experts highlight that lack of conversation and societal stigma contribute to ignorance. This phase can bring brain fog, joint pain, and sleep disturbances. While lifestyle changes and supplements can help, hormone therapy may be a safe and effective option for managing severe symptoms.

title: T20 WC standoff: BCB stays away, umpire stays on ‚Äî B'desh official officiates IND-NZ ODI
content: Despite Bangladesh Cricket Board's refusal to send its team to India for the T20 World Cup 2026 due to security concerns, a Bangladeshi umpire is officiating in an ongoing ODI series on Indian soil. This highlights the ICC's independent appointment process for neutral match officials, even amidst strained bilateral relations.

title: What about 'Chak Lo Revolver'? Haryana singers fume as cops hit pause on 67 songs
content: Haryana Police removed 67 songs glorifying violence and gangsterism from online platforms, citing negative influence on youth. Singer Masoom Sharma advocated for broader laws against obscenity and gambling apps, arguing against targeting individual artists. The DGP stated this action aims to protect young people from crime, emphasizing the harsh realities of criminal life.

title: UPSC CSE 2026 notification will not be released today: Here's what aspirants must know
content: The UPSC has postponed the release of the Civil Services Examination 2026 notification, a day after indicating a January 14 release on its website. No revised date has been announced so far. While the application timeline remains uncertain, the prelims exam is still scheduled for May 24, 2026, as per the exam calendar.

title: Mass dog killings rock Telangana: 300 strays given lethal injections
content: Police have filed cases against nine individuals, including two village sarpanches, in Hanumakonda district for allegedly killing approximately 300 stray dogs with lethal injections. The incident, which occurred between January 6 and 8, was reported by an NGO after buried carcasses were discovered.

title: One-ball endgame: ICC ball tweak ‚Äî why teams are rethinking death-overs batting
content: The Indian cricket team is adapting to new batting strategies for ODIs following a rule change allowing only one ball per innings after the 34th over. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak highlighted the need for a new approach, especially for the death overs, as older balls become softer and harder to hit.

title: Watch: Trump hurls abuse, shows middle finger to Ford worker who shouted ‚Äòpedophile protector‚Äô
content: During a Michigan visit, President Trump appeared to react angrily to a heckler shouting an insult, with video showing him gesturing with an expletive and the middle finger. This incident occurs amid ongoing scrutiny over the handling of files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, a figure Trump has past associations with.

title: Karnataka Biker's Throat Slit By Kite String, Dies After Call To Daughter
content: The killer kite string has struck again, this time in Karnataka. A 48-year-old motorcyclist has died after a kite string left him critically injured.

title: Why You Still Might Get Your Grocery Delivered In 10 Minutes
content: Quick commerce has always been about racing against the clock. Speed has been a competitive advantage that kept aggregators ahead of their rivals.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Beyond The 'Warm' Words Of US' New India Ambassador, Sergio Gor
content: US Ambassador to India, MAGA ideologue, and self-declared 'close friend' of President Donald Trump, Sergio Gor's posting as the Special Envoy to South and Central Asia is no ordinary appointment.

title: Crane At China-Backed Rail Project Collapses, Derails Thailand Train, 28 Dead
content: A train travelling from Thailand's capital, Bangkok, to the country's northeast was derailed after a construction crane fell on top of one of its carriages, killing at least 28 people and injuring more than 80, police said.

title: Lashkar Opens New Front Against Kashmir, Issues Fresh Threat To Hindus
content: Pakistan-based terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) has once again reiterated its commitment to violent jihad in Jammu and Kashmir, with its senior commander openly delivering a genocidal hate speech inciting mass violence against Hindus.

title: Drunk Excavator Operator Goes On Rampage In UP, Runs Over Parked Cars
content: On CCTV, the driver was seen losing control of the heavy machine and smashing multiple four-wheelers along the road.

title: 'Forgot Gravity Existed': Shubhanshu Shukla Talks To Children About Space Journey
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, who became the first Indian to go to the International Space Station (ISS), spoke to school kids about his experience at the New Delhi World Book Fair 2026 on Tuesday.

title: Wife Can Get 25% Of Husband's Income As Maintenance: Allahabad High Court
content: The court stated that the petitioner husband has not claimed any physical disability, and therefore, the court holds that the petitioner/husband is a healthy individual and cannot shrug away his obligation to provide for his wife.

title: Palak Paneer "Smell" Leads To Indian Students Winning Rs 1.8 Crore In US
content: Two Indian PhD students at the University of Colorado Boulder in the United States won a civil rights settlement worth $200,000, along with their dignity, after facing systemic discrimination over their choice of eating Indian food.

title: Explained: Why US May Not Attack Iran Despite Trump's 'Military Action' Threats
content: Emboldened by the seizure of the erstwhile Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro, US President Donald Trump has been threatening military action against Iran as the Islamic Republic's clerical rulers face the biggest wave of dissent in years.

title: Parts Of Dal Lake Freeze As Kashmir Reels Under Sub-Zero Temperatures
content: Parts of the famous Dal Lake here and several water bodies in Kashmir froze on Wednesday as sub-zero minimum temperatures across the Valley dropped further.

title: When A Danish MP Told Donald Trump To "F*** Off" Over Greenland Threats
content: US President Donald Trump has his eyes set on Greenland, and he's become more vocal than ever about it since the successful invasion of Venezuela and taking its President, Nicolas Maduro, in what many say was nothing short of an "abduction."

title: 'End Chief Minister Post Buzz': Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar To Rahul Gandhi
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar are learnt to have raised the chief ministership row with senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who visited the state yesterday

title: Trump's 25% Iran Tariffs Could Raise Prices In The US
content: The tariffs could create blowback for the US, potentially raising the prices Americans pay for imports from Iranian trade partners such as Turkish textiles and Indian gemstones and threatening an uneasy trade truce Trump reached last year with China.

title: Maharashtra To Vote For High-Stakes Civic Polls Tomorrow
content: As Maharashtra heads to the elections on Thursday for 29 municipal corporations, the spotlight is on Mumbai, where the BJP-led Mahayuti is locked in a battle with the united Thackeray front for control of the cash-rich BMC.

title: Video Shows Moment Pak Police's Armoured Vehicle Was Blown Up, Killing 7 Cops
content: A senior officer said five police personnel were killed on the spot after the remote-controlled bomb went off, while two others had died in hospital.

title: UP Medical College Staffer, 32, Shoots Himself Dead
content: A 32-year-old health worker posted at a medical college died by allegedly shooting himself in the head at his residence in Pratapgarh district of Uttar Pradesh, police said on Wednesday.

title: Tesla To Offer Self-Driving Software On Monthly Subscription Model: Elon Musk
content: Currently, Tesla allows its electric vehicle owners to purchase FSD (Supervised) for a one-time payment of $8,000 or a subscription of $99 per month in the US.

title: BMC, Other Maharashtra Civic Body Polls Tomorrow: 10 Questions Answered
content: The campaigning for local body elections in Maharashtra's metropolitan cities has ended. Voting will be held tomorrow, on January 15, in 29 municipal corporations in the state.

content: Denver Broncos defensive coordinator Vance Joseph was 38 years old . his r√©sum√© includes coordinator gigs with the Miami Dolphins and the Arizona Cardinals . he had just completed six years as a defensive backs coach with the Texans .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks remain Super Bowl favorites; Patriots now AFC front-runner
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the  Super Bowl . The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams , who advanced to the divisional round with a win on Saturday.  The  New England Patriots  and  Buffalo Bills  are now the top two favorites in the AFC after advancing to the Divisional round on Sunday. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the fifth-best odds to win the Super Bowl despite being the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, had a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.
